data.title: Valdearcos de la Vega. Traditional, in Stone, Cuco Valley.
data.meta_description: In between leafy valleys, we can enjoy its religious heritage: the church of la Virgen de la Asunción and the chapel of Nuestra Señora de la Zarzuela.
data.text:
The village is located in the middle of Cuco Valley, its civil and religious buildings are traditional and made from Stone.

Religious Monuments

The church of la Virgen de la Asunción is of one rectangular room and its walls a reinforced by buttresses. The presbytery is defined by a semicircle arc and the main chapel, built by Nicolás de Hoz, is rounded off with a star ribbed vaulted ceiling. The main altarpiece, from 1781, shows the sculpture of the Asunción de Medina de Rioseco Tomás de Sierra. The Gothic cross is made with molten silver.

The chapel of Nuestra Señora de la Zarzuela. Legend has it that: the Virgin Mary with the Baby Jesus and a clock were spotted in a bush by a shepherd from Curiel. As you can imagine, the

villages argued for the image of the Virgin. Finally, it was decided that the image of the Virgin would stay in Valdearcos: the image of the Baby Jesus with the clock is in Curiel.

The chapel of Santo Cristo.

In the centre of the village there is a Justice Pillar from the middle Ages.
